# Recipe: Stovetop Creamy Mushroom Pasta

## Introduction
Stovetop Creamy Mushroom Pasta is a delicious and comforting dish that combines the earthy flavors of mushrooms with a creamy sauce. This recipe is perfect for a quick and easy weeknight dinner or a special occasion. The creamy sauce is made with a combination of mushrooms, garlic, cream, and Parmesan cheese, creating a rich and satisfying pasta dish.

## Ingredients
- 8 ounces (225g) of pasta (linguine, fettuccine, or spaghetti)
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 pound (450g) mushrooms, sliced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup (240ml) heavy cream
- 1/2 cup (50g) grated Parmesan cheese
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

## Equipment
- Large pot for boiling pasta
- Large skillet or frying pan
- Wooden spoon or spatula
- Colander for draining pasta

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 20 minutes

## Steps
1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
2. In a large skillet or frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they start to release their moisture and turn golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
5. Reduce the heat to low and pour in the heavy cream. Stir well to combine with the mushrooms and garlic.
6. Sprinkle in the grated Parmesan cheese and continue stirring until the sauce thickens slightly and the cheese has melted.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss until it is well coated with the creamy mushroom sauce.
9. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh chopped parsley.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Stovetop Creamy Mushroom Pasta as a main course with a side of garlic bread or a green salad.
- Pair it with a glass of white wine, such as Chardonnay or Sauvignon Blanc, to complement the flavors of the dish.

## Variations
- For a vegetarian version, omit the butter and use olive oil instead.
- Add cooked chicken, shrimp, or bacon for a protein-packed variation.
- Incorporate other vegetables like spinach or sun-dried tomatoes for added flavor and nutrition.

## Tips and Tricks
- Use a mix of different mushrooms, such as cremini, shiitake, and oyster, to enhance the depth of flavor.
- Don't overcook the mushrooms as they can become mushy. Cook them until they are golden brown and slightly caramelized.
- If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of pasta cooking water to thin it out.
- Adjust the amount of garlic according to your preference. You can also add other herbs or spices like thyme or red pepper flakes for extra flavor.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional values may vary depending on the type and quantity of ingredients used. Here is an approximate breakdown per serving:
  - Calories: 500
  - Fat: 28g
  - Carbohydrates: 48g
  - Protein: 15g
  - Fiber: 3g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Stovetop Creamy Mushroom Pasta is best enjoyed fresh. However, if you have leftovers, store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- When reheating, add a splash of cream or milk to the pasta to restore some creaminess.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use a different type of pasta?
   - Yes, feel free to use your favorite type of pasta. Linguine, fettuccine, or spaghetti work well with this recipe.
2. Can I use a different type of mushroom?
   - Absolutely! You can use any type of mushroom you prefer or have on hand.
3. Can I make this recipe dairy-free?
   - Yes, you can substitute the heavy cream with a non-dairy alternative like coconut milk or cashew cream.
4. Can I freeze the leftovers?
   - It is not recommended to freeze this dish as the creamy sauce may separate when thawed and reheated.
